Description: Deep wheel-made pottery lamp with rounded walls, a sunken rim, and a tapering flat-topped nozzle with a rounded end. The raised base is flat below. Covered with a dark brown slip. Resinous black coating covers the whole, suggesting this was burnt. Dark brown mica rich fabric.
Curator's comments: Copy of Athenian type (Howland 1958, Type 25). Parallel found in Hadra cemetery, Alexandria (Adriani 1940, pls 28,29,31.2). Late 4th or 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Blondé 1998, 319-20, no. 14). Adriani, A. 1940, Municipalité d’Alexandrie, Annuaire du musée Gréco-Romain, Volume II (1935-1939), Alexandria. Blondé, F. 1998. Lampes tournée Hellénistiques du Musée D’Alexandrie, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 307-35. Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals, Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q524)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.49) (Phase 1)
